SEARCH
Package executor.service.controller

Class ScenarioController

java.lang.Object
executor.service.controller.ScenarioController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/scenario") public class ScenarioController extends Object
Controller class handling HTTP requests related to scenarios in the application.

This class is annotated with @RestController, indicating that it combines @Controller and @ResponseBody, making it suitable for handling REST-full web service requests. The base request mapping is set to "/scenario," making this controller responsible for scenarios-related endpoints.

The class works in conjunction with the ScenarioService to handle various scenario-related operations and manage the interaction between the client and the application's business logic.

Endpoints within this controller are designed to support scenarios, allowing clients to perform actions such as retrieving scenario details, creating new scenarios, updating existing ones, or deleting scenarios based on specific HTTP methods.

Ensure proper dependency injection of the ScenarioService to enable seamless communication between the controller and the underlying business logic for scenarios.

Consider further customization of this controller by adding additional methods and request mappings to support additional scenario-related functionalities as needed.

See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getScenariosByUsername

      @GetMapping("/queue/{username}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Scenario>> getScenariosByUsername(@PathVariable String username)
      Handles HTTP GET requests to retrieve scenarios associated with a specific username.

      This method is annotated with @GetMapping, specifying the endpoint "/queue/{username}" for handling GET requests related to scenarios. The provided username in the path is used to identify and fetch scenarios associated with the specified user from the underlying ScenarioService.

      The method delegates the scenario retrieval operation to the ScenarioService, which interacts with the application's business logic to obtain the relevant scenarios.

      The retrieved scenarios are returned in the response body, wrapped in a ResponseEntity with an HTTP status of HttpStatus.OK. If scenarios are not found for the given username, an empty list is returned with a status of HttpStatus.OK to indicate a successful request with no scenarios found.

      This endpoint is designed to provide clients with the ability to view scenarios associated with a specific user by making a GET request to the "/queue/{username}" endpoint.

      Parameters:
      username - The username for which scenarios are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of scenarios and an HTTP status. If scenarios are found, the status is HttpStatus.OK; otherwise, it remains HttpStatus.OK, indicating an empty list.
      See Also:
      • GetMapping
      • ResponseEntity
      • HttpStatus
      • ScenarioService

    • getScenariosByName

      @GetMapping("/queue/{username}/{scenarioName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Scenario>> getScenariosByName(@PathVariable String username, @PathVariable String scenarioName)
      Handles HTTP GET requests to retrieve scenarios based on a specific username and scenario name.

      This method is annotated with @GetMapping, specifying the endpoint "/queue/{username}/{scenarioName}" for handling GET requests related to scenarios with a particular username and scenario name. The provided username and scenario name in the path are used to identify and fetch scenarios from the underlying ScenarioService.

      The method delegates the scenario retrieval operation to the ScenarioService, which interacts with the application's business logic to obtain the relevant scenarios.

      The retrieved scenarios are returned in the response body, wrapped in a ResponseEntity with an HTTP status of HttpStatus.OK. If scenarios are not found for the given username and scenario name, an empty list is returned with a status of HttpStatus.OK to indicate a successful request with no scenarios found.

      This endpoint is designed to provide clients with the ability to view scenarios associated with a specific user and scenario name by making a GET request to the "/queue/{username}/{scenarioName}" endpoint.

      Parameters:
      username - The username for which scenarios are to be retrieved.
      scenarioName - The name of the scenario to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a list of scenarios and an HTTP status. If scenarios are found, the status is HttpStatus.OK; otherwise, it remains HttpStatus.OK, indicating an empty list.
      See Also:
      • GetMapping
      • ResponseEntity
      • HttpStatus
      • ScenarioService

    • createScenario

      @PostMapping("/queue") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> createScenario(@RequestBody List<Scenario> scenarios)
      Handles HTTP POST requests to create scenarios by saving a list of scenarios.

      This method is annotated with @PostMapping, specifying the endpoint "/queue" for handling POST requests related to scenario creation. The list of scenarios provided in the request body is processed and saved using the ScenarioService.

      The method delegates the scenario creation operation to the ScenarioService, which interacts with the application's business logic to save the provided scenarios.

      The response is a ResponseEntity with an HTTP status of HttpStatus.CREATED to indicate a successful creation of scenarios. The response body is empty, as the focus is on signaling the success of the operation.

      This endpoint is designed to allow clients to submit a list of scenarios for creation by making a POST request to the "/queue" endpoint.

      Parameters:
      scenarios - The list of scenarios to be created and saved.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity<Void> indicating the success of the scenario creation with an HTTP status of HttpStatus.CREATED.
      See Also:
      • PostMapping
      • ResponseEntity
      • HttpStatus
      • ScenarioService
